column4: what options do i have when my computer doesnt see my harddisk? it starts spinning but then stops and wont be mounted, can i force this or anything for recovery
Is it not listed with `sudo fdisk -l` ?
Unplug it. Replug and check `dmesg` does it list any new events?
i do get a pretty big list but i guess it has to be on the bottom line? there doenst seem to be anything related to a harddisk
Yeah. OK I mean do `dmesg` unplug+replug, and dmesg again. See what's new
do you think the actual hardware is bust? how long after you connect it does it power down (every time for the same duration)? Does it make weird noises?
yeah its probably bust, it sound well, starts spinning but after 10-20secs it just stops
Try it on a different machine, with a different cord if possible
does it mean that theres noway i can recover my data?
If the hardware is busted you could take it to a recovery specialist, but their services aren't cheap

Last last last resort , I heard that if you put it in the freezer for a few hours in a sealed bag. Then you take it out and have 10 mins to recover what you can before it's permanently gone. That's just what I heard though, you should google some more tips)
oke its worth a try :) and to open up the disk?
thanks for the help i will try the freezer :)
OK, please google this method to see what others have said about it. There should be more info
And a _sealed_ bag so no moisture enters
